free_text.Content: 1. Introduction - Real-time systems and their characteristics[br/]2. Model ling real-time systems - context and types[br/]3. Asynchronous models of logical behavior - Petri nets[br/]4. Synchronous models - GRAFCET (link with synchronous languages)[br/]5. Programming real-time systems (polling, cyclic executives, co-routines, state based programming)[br/]6. Real-time kernels and operating systems - problems, principles, mechanisms (synchronous and sporadic tasks, synchronization, event and time management)[br/]7. Scheduling - problem, constraints, taxonomy[br/]8. Fixed priority and deadline oriented scheduling[br/]9. Scheduling in presence of shared resources, precedence constraints and overloads[br/]10.Scheduling of continuous media tasks[br/]11.Evaluation of worst case execution times[br/]12. Introduction to real-time distributed systems
